definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: One of the jurors immediately declares himself in favour of the utmost rigour of the law being applied to the young woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一名陪审员当即宣布希望能用最严厉的法律制裁她。

sentences.english: Those who sexually harrass the opposite sex will be punished by the law.
sentences.chinese: 异性进行性侵犯会受到法律制裁。

sentences.english: She once faced legal action for not buying a license for her pet dog.
sentences.chinese: 她曾因没有给宠物狗购买养狗证而面临法律制裁。

sentences.english: Those who evade tax will be punished by the law.
sentences.chinese: 偷税漏税者将受到法律制裁。

definition: It is hard to escape the dragnet of the law/the long arm of the law
to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to challenge the law (idiom)/to knowingly violate the law
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
loose, but allows no escape (idiom, from Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]); the way of Heaven is fair, but the guilty will not escape
